intro: Hemitelia abitaguensis, commonly known as the Abitagua hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and often branching. Hemitelia abitaguensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
